doc:
Bess Meredyth https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bess_Meredyth 0 Bess Meredyth (February 12, 1890 – July 13, 1969) was a screenwriter and silent film actress. The wife of film director Michael Curtiz, Meredyth wrote The Affairs of Cellini (1934) and adapted The Unsuspected (1947). She was one of the 36 founders of the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences. Bess_Meredyth ( February_12_,_1890 – July_13_,_1969 ) was a_screenwriter and silent_film_actress . The_wife of film_director_Michael_Curtiz , Meredyth wrote The_Affairs of Cellini_(_1934_) and adapted The_Unsuspected_(_1947_) . She was one of the_36_founders of the_Academy of Motion_Picture_Arts_and_Sciences .
